title: What is the relationship between traditional rituals and the concept of a shaman as a hero figure?
first_phrase: In the last 200 tokens of this text, the author reflects on the concept of the "shaman" and their ability to navigate the world of chaos and make a pact with it, all while maintaining control during a trance state. The author discusses the confusion that arises from degrading elements of savages and higher-order phenomena. The author cites examples from various civilizations, including Chinese and Hindu, of the function of man as a central power beyond heaven and earth, reinforcing the idea that the role of the shaman is to establish order in the world of the supernatural.
content: Una eguale confusione fra elementi degradati dei selvaggi e elementi di un ordine piú alto s'incontra, nel De Martino, quando egli parla di chi svolge propriamente la parte di ma go. Questi, mediante procedimenti vari, l'entrare in transe, ecc., sembra acutizzare lo stato di pericolo e di rischio sentito dal primitivo; egli indebolisce deliberatamente il senso della presenza a sè e provoca un sollevamento di realtà psichiche che sembrano sommergerlo; ma non si perde. last_phrase: In conclusion, the ultimate goal of the shaman, according to De Martino, is to master the forces of the supersensible world by deliberately weakening their sense of self and inducing a state of trance to bring about a renewal of the self. The shaman walks a fine line, balancing on the edge of chaos, but emerges with a renewed awareness and control of their existence. This process aligns with the traditional concepts of initiation, with the only difference being in the type of civilization that requires different modalities.
